data.title: Retro charm
data.text: Cute old fashioned diner with great pancakes, especially the pumpkin cranberry. The coffee is pretty good. Come here if you want to feel you are stepping back in time.  Tables are small so don't bring a big group.

data.title: Call Health Code Enforcement
data.text:
Dorothy's just isn't any good at all. You go in and everything's for sale. Ugly clocks, terrible art that I'm guessing the owner's children "created", old fruit...it's very embarrassing.

At best the food is average and the service is slow and borderline rude. The heavy older lady moves like a slug in slow motion and always calls everyone Young Man. Heard her say this to an elderly man....why would she patronize the gentleman?

Several years ago when I went in, at least the service was great on weekends, as there were two delightful young women who worked there with lovely smiles who aimed to please. One had red hair and just gotten a graphic design major at the local college. The other was African American. Totally great! They gave the crummy place some needed youth and beauty.

I think the owner's daughter bailed, which is good. People don't care for fur and army boots with fake pink hair.

And aren't cooks required to wear hair nets? That's a Health Law last I checked, yet the owner doesn't wear one when she cooks. She seems to be getting on up there in years (probably pushing sixty-five, which is fine) but she's starting to get thin on top; she's losing her hair. No hair nets! 

I came out of the bathroom after washing my hands and observed the owner picking her teeth with her fingers and then using the same fingers to scoop a sandwich onto a plate. I'm not picky, but Jesus! Someone needs to inform the Health Code Enforcement.

data.title: A Step Back in Time...
data.text: Our son took us here for breakfast.  Huge servings, and a delightful 50s diner atmosphere.  Quaint main street to walk after eating also.

data.title: Worst place ever!!
data.text: The food was terrible. I went here for breakfast and the eggs were the only thing edible. The fruit looked like it came out of the can. Nothing there is homemade. When they say CHUCK WAGON, That's exactly what your getting. I asked for my money back! I couldn't eat anything. Oh, and to top it all off... They don't take VISA cards! Worst place ever:/

data.title: had lunch there
data.text: nice quite place the waitress was really nice and on top of everything. food was good. and good size portions. you need to know that it is cash only but they have an atm inside.

data.title: Hair in my food
data.text: I really enjoy supporting local places but I was so disappointed with this place.  The cook had long greasy hair that was loose, no hair net or even a pony tail.  The food wasn't very good plus there were 2 hairs in it and my water glass had lipstick on it.  I won't go back!

data.title: Worth the Drive.....
data.text:
This place is little but the food is Excellent,Great portions are huge make sure you have a big appetite and some time.We sit and drink coffee and catch up from the week before.It's down home cooking at it's best. Owner's are very nice & the girl's ( waitress )
are there anytime you need anything.

data.title: Old Town Camarillo
data.text: I've been going to Dorothy's since I was a kid back in the 70's.  It was great then ...and it's great today!

data.title: Not good
data.text: The food here is below average. The atmosphere is unpleasant. I have no idea why anyone would return. There are so many places in Camarillo serving better, fresher, tastier breakfasts. I guess this is just a bad habit for some. I sure won't be back.

data.title: Old time diner
data.text: This place probably has not changed in 30 years, and that is the charm. Good food, friendly service, and the bumper stickers on the walls will keep you entertained. They take cash only and close at 1p. There is an ATM inside as well.

data.title: Old Camarillo at its best
data.text: Great independant diner that offers a great selection of breakfast and lunch. Coffee is always good and in full flow, been here many times and always had a great meal.

data.title: Down Home Cookin'
data.text: We stoppd in for Breakfast - it is a samll cafe - one that I would call Mom and Pop Cafe.  Not sure but that tis the sense I came away with.  There seemed to be some "regulars" in there chatting away with the waitress and cook.  Very friendly atmosphere.  We order potatoes, eggs, and one of us ordered pancakes.  All pretty good.  The place seemed clean and in order - that is one thing I always notice before I sit down.  We decided that we would go back sometime.

data.title: Great bacon & eggs
data.text: An old time local hangout. Since breakfast is breakfast and Camarillo has a 14 way tie for the worst breakfast in town, Dorothy's is my choice for number 1. It's as average as every other place in town.

data.title: Disappointing!
data.text:
Restaurant very much needing renovation. Seating sparse. and Food just average and priced too high.Disappointing!
DF, Camarillo

data.title: A Great Local Breakfast/lunch  Hang In Camarillo
data.text: Pancakes and Bacon! Great Eggs dishes with all kinds of extras. Great Sandwiches  and salads as well. This is American Cooking at it's finest. If you want to meet local Camarillo people, this IS the place.

data.title: Sweet Potato, Pumpkin & Almond Pancakes!
data.text: Went for a late breakfast.  Pumpkin/cranberry pancakes, 7 grain/almond pancakes & jalapeño eggs Benedict we 3 enjoyed all of it a lot!  Great service as well!

data.title: Old fashion cafe
data.text: This cafe could be in any small town in America. Rather iconic. The coffee is strong and the eggs are cooked to order. The regulars ask for the usual. Nothing fancy or frilly. Just good food.

data.title: Great Service Great Food Great Value
data.text: A great spot for lunch or breakfast.  Small place with great service.  Lunch comes with free dessert of the day.

data.title: A gem of a place - freshly cooked home-style food run by the owners
data.text: What an absolute treat.  The boss and I had just been to the Camarillo Air Museum (the B29 was flying today) and we needed refuelling.  Drove through Camarillo Old Town and spotted Dorothy's on the corner.  SO glad we stopped.  Lovely staff and a great pitstop. The boss had pancakes (his favourite - and hugely enjoyed): I broke with all tradition and went mad.  I had the grilled breakfast sandwich (scrambled egg and grilled cheese on toasted sourdough, but with tomato rather than 4-legged extras) with DIVINE home fries. Not only will we go back, but we will take friends and visitors from 'back home' there.

data.title: "Great hole in the wall !"
data.text:
This place is exactly what the title states. "It's got a screen door for Gods sake!"
The service is great and so is the food. Anybody who gives this place less than excellent (For what it is) is an idiot. You get a ton of food for next to nothing and it is very flavorful.
